title: Assessment Phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: why are we starting this participation process?
description: Mapping the expectations of the participation process ahead by collecting and verifying the requirements available and/ or needed for the participation process.
mapping: using the parameters of the actor network map as input for the assessment
activation: Written proposal: matching the requirements and expectations in a written project proposal to create a supported and realistic approach (underline: hyperlink to page activations)
output: collective expectation for the participation process ahead
iteration: discrepancy between the expectations of internal parties

title: Exploration Phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: who is here?
description: Studying what actors are there and how are they related by collecting and verifying the information regarding the area, actors and relations between the actors
methods: Actor Mapping , Surveys, Online Ethnography , Web Scraping
mapping: filling up the generic template to create a contextual actor network map
activation: Sharing data: connecting and exchanging data with the other perspectives
output: overview of the area, the actors and relations
iteration: questions/ tensions/ assumptions about the definition of the area, actors or relations

title: Definition Phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: who and what do we know and have?
description: Defining the potentials for participation by identifying the possibilities for participation
methods: Mind Mapping, Personas , Journey Mapping , Relational Mapping , Focus Groups
activation: Onboarding: the actors for the participation process ahead
iteration: the area/ actors/ relations/ conditions have changed

title: Research Phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: who and what donâ€™t we know or have?
description: Defining the aim of the participation by filling in the knowledge gaps to turn the possibilities into participation chances
mapping: using the available visual stories to identify the focus for the sessions
activation: Sharing insights: sharing new findings with the actors

title: Co-creation phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: what do we need for participation?
description: Co-creating space for the differences and connections between stakeholders by designing, producing en documenting participation sessions
methods: Scenario Building, Empathy Mapping, Serious Games, Tangible Tools, Participatory Mapping, Cultural Probes
mapping: using the available visual stories for informative purposes
iteration: discrepancy between the expectations of external parties

title: Dessimination phase
subtitle: In this phase we focus on the question: what did we learn?
description: Presenting the outcomes of the participation sessions by transforming the collected information to actionable insights fitting the audience
mapping: using the available visual stories for illustrative purposes
activation: Presentation in person: presenting the insights to other use cases by an interactive presentation (lecture/ workshop/ live presentation) where feedback and potential adaptations can be collected
output: collection of the findings and learnings

title: Adaptation Phase
subtitle: In this phase the main focus is to answer the question: how can we act?
description: Applying the outcomes to the reality by defining the potential impact of the output
mapping: using the collected data as input for the design team
activation: Reporting: sharing a report with the design team, in collaboration with the other perspectives
output: guidance to apply findings and learnings
